test_cases.objective: Verify that the system accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.

test_steps.action: Set up the calibrated temperature reference device in the monitored storage area.
test_steps.expected_result: Reference device displays stable temperature reading.

test_steps.action: Compare the system's temperature reading with the reference device reading.
test_steps.expected_result: System reading matches reference device within ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Repeat comparison at three different temperature points (-80°C, 0°C, +50°C).
test_steps.expected_result: All readings remain within specified accuracy range.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings remain within ±0.5°C of reference values
System maintains accuracy across full operational range
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for accurate data recording
data_integrity_requirements: Temperature data must be accurate and unaltered
All readings must be properly timestamped

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system properly generates and transmits alarm notifications when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint.
prerequisites: Paging system available for integration testing

test_steps.action: Set temperature setpoint to 5°C and wait for system stabilization.
test_steps.expected_result: System maintains stable temperature monitoring.

test_steps.action: Artificially induce temperature deviation to 7.1°C (above +2°C threshold).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates audible/visual alarm within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Verify alarm notification is received by paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system receives and displays alarm notification.

test_steps.action: Repeat test for low temperature deviation (2.9°C).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates appropriate alarm for -2°C deviation.

acceptance_criteria: Alarms generated within 30 seconds of threshold breach
Notifications properly transmitted to paging system
Alarms generated for both high and low deviations
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 requirements for alarm documentation
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm events must be properly logged with timestamps
Notification content must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS continuously monitors temperature in all GMP storage areas as specified in URS-EMS-001.

test_steps.action: Access the EMS software interface.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS software interface is accessible and displays current temperature readings.

test_steps.action: Verify temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are recorded at intervals of 5 minutes or less.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are continuously monitored and recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as specified in URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to a known value.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature setpoint is successfully set.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for the temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: To ensure the system accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to -80°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The system displays a temperature reading within -80.5°C to -79.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to +50°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The system displays a temperature reading within +49.5°C to +50.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the setpoint
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are accurately recorded and stored

test_cases.objective: To verify that alarm notifications are correctly integrated with the site paging system using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The system generates an alarm and sends a notification to the site paging system.

test_steps.action: Verify the alarm notification on the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: The site paging system receives and displays the alarm notification.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications must be received by the site paging system within 30 seconds
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are accurately recorded and transmitted

test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to -80°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS displays a temperature reading within ±0.5°C of -80°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to +50°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS displays a temperature reading within ±0.5°C of +50°C.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature data is accurately recorded and stored.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS integrates with the site paging system and correctly sends alarm notifications when temperature deviations occur.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS triggers an alarm and sends a notification to the site paging system.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications must be received by the site paging system within 30 seconds of the deviation.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure alarm notifications are accurately logged and transmitted.

test_cases.test_name: Integration Test: Alarm Notification with Site Paging System
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS correctly integrates with the site paging system for alarm notifications using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation exceeding ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS triggers an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Check the site paging system for the alarm notification.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is received on the site paging system.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notification is successfully sent to the site paging system within 30 seconds of the alarm condition.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are logged with accurate timestamps.

test_cases.test_name: Performance Test: System Response Time for Alarm Conditions
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS responds to alarm conditions within the specified 30-second timeframe.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation exceeding ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS triggers an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Measure the time taken from the alarm condition to the system response.
test_steps.expected_result: System response time does not exceed 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: System responds to alarm conditions within 30 seconds.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm responses are logged with accurate timestamps.
